Parents/Guardians/Community Members

The Tri-Point School District is hosting an open forum with the Tri-Point community to discuss not only the current status of softball/baseball but also any future considerations for the continuation of these sports.

The meeting will be held in the Kempton Gym at 6:00 on Wednesday, July 8. We will observe social distancing during the meeting.

As many of you know, our ability to field teams in these two sports has been inconsistent over the last few years. Many variables have factored into this with low participation and student safety being at the forefront.

Our goal is to gauge community interest in strategies needed to build and sustain a team and to focus on the community/school relationship in regards to the continuation of these two sports and their survival in a school setting.

Medical Staff
Corbin and Wyatt Breen have been working with teachers to 3D print mask extenders for medical personnel, and have shipped out their first batch of about 120 this week to the Piper City Rehab & Living Center and to hospitals. The extenders relieve stress on medical staff members' ears when they wear masks for long periods of time. The boys are actively making more, and will be glad to send them out to medical staff at local facilities. They hope to start making face shields, soon, too. Contact Mr. Saffer at the Jr. High if you need some, or have any questions - saffers@tripointschools.org
Elementary and junior high students are also encouraged to check the Art website for art project ideas to show support to medical personnel.
